item.title: All of this because PNoy's people encouraged innovation in one agency. But they did so too for many others. Open data for DBM. Nudge economics for NEDA (regulatory impact assessment). Probabilistic risk assessment for project NOAH. PMT for poverty identification for DSWD. (15/n)

Quick update! The @cityofhamilton has told us that it's now working on a new open data map to show the locations of all of its water fountain infrastructure. It should be done in July. We'll let you know as soon as it's live and will keep updating our map in the meantime. #HamOnt
